definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: He needs to improve his English before he can study abroad.
sentences.chinese: 他到国外念书之前必须先加强英文。

sentences.english: I cannot overemphasize the psychological trauma to these people.
sentences.chinese: 我无法更加强强调他们所受的心理创伤。

sentences.english: Smooth downshifts are enhanced by a standard, back-torque limiting clutch.

sentences.english: They said all countries need to strengthen oversight and crisis management mechanisms.

sentences.english: Fourthly, the international community should increase aid to Africa.
sentences.chinese: 第四，加强国际社会的对非援助。

sentences.english: Part IV is to discuss how to strengthenpsychology health education to suit teachers school graduates needs in ChongqingMunicipality.

sentences.english: It reinforces the value of Random Password Manager to security-conscious enterprise environments.
sentences.chinese: 它加强了随机密码管理器在安全企业环境下的价值。

sentences.english: An increasing number of people are realising the neccesity to protect enviroment.
sentences.chinese: 世界上越来越多的人认识到加强环境保护的必要性。

To make defence education universal and foster such education is the common responsibility of the whole society.
sentences.chinese: 普及和加强国防教育是全社会的共同责任。

sentences.english: Fourth, we will continue to strengthen management of local government debt.
sentences.chinese: 四是继续加强地方政府性债务管理。

sentences.english: For social youth groups, public propagand is necessary.

definition: (of systems, facilities etc) comprehensive/well-developed/excellent/to refine/to improve
to promote (an idea or cause)/to advance/boost
to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
to impel/to carry forward/to push on/to advance/to drive forward
